title: 2016 (S. I. No. 393 of 2016) (as adapted by the Communications, Climate Action
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Air Pollution Act 1987 (Solid
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Air Pollution Act 1987 (Solid 

Fuels) (Amendment) Regulations 2025. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 31 March 2025.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited air pollution act 1987 (solid fuels) (amendment) regulation 2025 (2) regulation come operation 31 march 2025

title: 2016 (S. I. No. 393 of 2016) (as adapted by the Communications, Climate Action
heading: 2. The Air Pollution Act 1987 (Solid Fuels) Regulations 2022, Regulation
text_raw:
2. The Air Pollution Act 1987 (Solid Fuels) Regulations 2022, Regulation 

5(4) is amended - 

By substituting for Regulation 5(4)(b) the following: 

(b) 

subject to a market assessment, with effect from 1 September 
2030, have sulphur content less than 1% by weight on a dry ashfree basis. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

7 March, 2025. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for the Environment, Climate and 
Communications. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 14th March, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [76] 3
text_norm: 2 air pollution act 1987 (solid fuels) regulation 2022 regulation 5(4) amended - substituting regulation 5(4)(b) following (b) subject market assessment effect 1 september 2030 sulphur content le 1 weight dry ashfree basis given official seal 7 march 2025 darragh brien minister environment climate communication notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 14th march 2025 76 3

title: 2016 (S. I. No. 393 of 2016) (as adapted by the Communications, Climate Action
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The original regulation proposed that coal products and manufactured solid 
fuels, including manufactured part biomass products, must have sulphur content 
less than 1% by weight on a dry ash-free basis from the 1st of September 2025, 
subject to a market assessment. 

Following the assessment, it was determined that it was not appropriate to reduce 
the sulphur level at this point and instead it should be re-assessed before 
September 2030. as such this provision is being amended in this regulation. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [76]
